report_title: Fast Food Chicken Franchises Industry Report
executive_summary: The Fast Food Chicken Franchises industry operates franchised chicken restaurants where clients pay before eating. This industry includes take-out, delivery and purchases consumed on-site. For most of the five years to 2020, economic growth has resulted in higher levels of disposable income. Simultaneously, consumer preferences have shifted as more individuals have become more health-conscious. During the five-year period, the industry has grappled with these significant changes in downstream demand by expanding menus to include healthier alternatives. Additionally, in 2020, industry revenue has taken a hit by the COVID-19 (coronavirus) outbreak, which has reduced consumer spending levels significantly. As a result, industry revenue is expected to grow an annualized 2.5% to $30.1 billion over the five years to 2020. This includes an anticipated revenue decrease of 14.0% in 2020 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Fast Food Chicken Franchises industry operates franchised chicken restaurants
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Fast Food Chicken Franchises industry operates franchised chicken restaurants where customers pay before eating. Consumers can opt to consume their meal on-site, take it home or have it delivered.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry demand increased as rising per capita disposable income permitted consumers to dine out more frequently
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the past five years, industry demand increased as rising per capita disposable income permitted consumers to dine out more frequently. Before taking a hit by the coronavirus pandemic starting in 2020, the number of domestic trips taken by US residents was increasing.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The industry has contended with changes in consumer preferences due to growing health consciousness
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: At the same time, the industry has contended with changes in consumer preferences due to growing health consciousness. The Fast Food Chicken Franchises industry has hastily responded to these changes, which has helped bolster industry revenue during the five-year period.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry revenue grew at an annualized rate of 2.5% to $30.1 billion over the five years to 2020
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the five years to 2020, industry revenue has grown at an annualized rate of 2.5% to $30.1 billion. This annualized growth includes a 14.0% decline in 2020, however, as the industry was hit by the coronavirus outbreak, which caused industry operators to temporarily close for dine-in operations starting in mid-March 2020.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Fast Food Chicken Franchises industry is forecast to continue growing over the five years to 2025
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Fast Food Chicken Franchises industry is forecast to continue growing over the five years to 2025, as it continues to benefit from the trends of the previous period and recovers from the coronavirus-induced recession.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Increasing consumer spending and the number of domestic trips will continue to bolster demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Increasing consumer spending and the number of domestic trips will continue to bolster demand for industry services. The industry will continue to provide convenient and inexpensive food to time-strapped individuals.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry competition is expected to intensify as other fast food franchises begin to offer more chicken alternatives
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: However, industry competition is expected to intensify as other fast food franchises begin to offer more chicken alternatives.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: IBISWorld estimates industry revenue to increase at an annualized rate of 7.6% to $43.4 billion over the five years to 2025
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Overall, IBISWorld estimates industry revenue to increase at an annualized rate of 7.6% to $43.4 billion over the five years to 2025.

industry_definition: This industry operates franchised chicken restaurants where patrons pay before eating. Purchases may be consumed on-site, taken out or delivered. Reports in IBISWorld's Business Franchise collection focus solely on the operation of franchised outlets and exclude nonfranchise data. They show the total number of franchise outlets, total franchise revenue and the average profit margin earned by franchisees. These reports also highlight the largest franchisors by market share.

mixed_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: medium - steady

key_trends: The coronavirus pandemic has slashed demand as travel and dining out have slowed

The industry exhibits strong and steady growth. As a result of the industry's consistent growth, the number of enterprises and establishments are expected to increase an annualized 4.5% and 4.0%, respectively, over the 10 years to 2025, due to rising demand for industry services.

During the 10-year period, consumers have become increasingly health and calorie-conscious. This shift in consumer preferences toward healthier options has resulted in industry operators reformulating their recipes and expanding their menus.

While industry operators have adjusted their menus, they have also adapted to changes in consumers' lifestyles. According to a study commissioned by Chick-fil-A, 82.0% of millennials claim they would like to avoid lines at fast food restaurants. Furthermore, 48.0% claimed they would prefer not to dine out if it required waiting in line. As employment has increased, consumers are increasingly time-strapped. Therefore, industry operators have responded and are continuously trying to incorporate new technology to improve on existing processes.
Operators have adapted their menus to reflect changes in consumer preferences
Consumers are increasingly viewing chicken as a healthier alternative to beef
Operators are expected to continue introducing healthier and premium menu items
External competition from other fast food retailers is expected to intensify
Operators will continue to invest in technology to improve customer service and operations
The industry has benefited from recent studies pointing to the benefits of leaner meats

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers in this income bracket have the largest levels of disposable income, enabling them to eat away from home more often than other income segments. However, these households also consistently trade up their consumption away from home, choosing to dine at full-service and high-end dining establishments. These consumers often spend more per meal as well, consuming more high-quality and luxury food items.

Similar to consumers in other income segments, consumers who earn less than $50,000 are increasingly pressed for time often finding preparing meals at home to be a challenge. However, consumers in this income segment can often find eating away from home challenging to afford, especially at full-service establishments that placed high premiums on their food due to the increased service they provide. However, fast food restaurants specializing in fast, convenient and generally low-priced food items that are popular for households that earn less than $50,000.

Individuals in this category often have limited time available outside of work to grocery shop, cook and prepare meals for consumption. Additionally, individuals in this income range have a moderate amount of disposable income to spend on food. These individuals often do not have to make a significant sacrifice to afford meals provided by this industry.

Although individuals in this income segment are similarly pressed for time, limiting their ability and willingness to prepare food at home, their increased levels of disposable income enable them to trade up to higher quality food service establishments for their meals. Often consumers in this segment will opt to dine at full-service establishments that offer convenient service, but typically at a higher price.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Meals prepared for immediate consumption on premise
Meals prepared and delivered through drive-thru service
Meals Prepared for Immediate Consumption Off-Premise
products_and_services.product_description: Many industry establishments have begun to establish themselves in city environments where drive-thru windows are not a capability. These establishments require customers to enter the restaurant and order their meals at a walk-up counter. However, many customers do not have the time to eat at industry establishments and take their meals to go, eating in their car, at their desk or any location off-premise.

Beverage sales represent 9.9% of industry revenue. This segment includes all sales of beverages except those that are a part of combination meal orders. Most industry operators do not serve alcoholic beverages, so they are limited to soft drinks, lemonades, teas and water.

Other products and services provided by industry establishments include the sale of side items that are not included as a part of combination meal orders. They may also include party orders and catering services.

Restaurant & Hotel Equipment Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Major Household Appliance Manufacturing in the US
Frozen Food Production in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Changes in popular dietary trends can greatly affect demand for industry products and services. Over the past five years, consumers have adjusted their preferences for food away from home as they have become increasingly health and environmentally conscience. Fast food establishments, including chicken franchises, have historically been known to serve high-fat and calorically dense foods that have become increasingly unpopular among many US consumers.

Convenience is a very important demand determinant since industry establishments aim to provide quick and quality service to consumers. As consumers become increasingly busy, the time dedicated to meals has been reduced, increasing demand for convenient food options provided by industry establishments.

international_trade_points.trade_description: As a service industry, the Fast Food Chicken Franchises industry is not engaged in importing or exporting products, so international trade is not relevant to the industry.
As a service industry, the Fast Food Chicken Franchises industry is not engaged in importing or exporting products, so international trade is not relevant to the industry.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast has the highest concentration of business locations, representing 25.0% of industry establishments. The Southeast has the highest share of the US population and is home to many of the industry's largest operators such as Zaxby's, Chick-fil-A and Popeyes Louisiana Kitchen. Chicken, particularly fried chicken, is a staple of Southern comfort food for which this region is best known.

The West region has the second-largest concentration, representing 17.8% of industry establishments. This region's concentration is primarily due to the high concentration of the US population within this region. Furthermore, this region is dominated by the state of California, which is home to 12.8% of establishments and 12.1% of the US population.

The Mid-Atlantic follows, representing 16.5% of industry locations. Similar to the West region, the high concentration of establishments in this region is primarily driven by the high population concentration in this region. The Mid-Atlantic is home to three of the country's largest cities, New York City, Philadelphia and Washington D.C., driving the population concentration. New York represents 7.1% of business locations; however, these establishments are primarily concentrated in and around New York City due to the high population in that area.

Regions such as New England and the Rocky Mountains regions have the lowest share of industry locations representing 4.5% and 3.6% respectively. These regions have the smallest concentration of the US population making them less desirable for businesses to establish franchise locations in these regions.

Regions such as New England and the Rocky Mountains regions have the lowest share of industry locations representing 4.5% and 3.6% respectively. These regions have the smallest concentration of the US population making them less desirable for businesses to establish franchise locations in these regions. Typically, the population in these areas is generally spread out with few major cities for populations to congregate.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Food service operators are subject to laws and regulations concerning the handling, preparation and sale of food and beverage items.
Local establishments ensure that food service establishments are abiding by the national policy in addition to possibly adding their own stipulations.
The recent implementation of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA) requires restaurant companies to disclose calorie information on their menus.

The industry relies heavily on young and low-skilled labor that are often paid at hourly rates. As a result, industry operators are subject to federal and state minimum wage and employee benefit requirements.
Since this industry comprises franchise establishments, operators are subject to regulations that govern franchise agreements.

basis_points.basis_description: Fast food chicken franchises often compete on the basis of price and quality as a result of increasing levels of competition.
Industry operators also compete on the basis of location, style, ambiance and quality of service.
The Fast Food Chicken Franchises industry also experiences high levels of external competition from the broader food service subsector.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The Fast Food Chicken Franchises industry has a moderate level of market share concentration with the top four players accounting for more than 70.0% of industry revenue in 2020.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Food and other key ingredients are usually purchased from wholesalers, particularly from operators that can assure quick delivery and high quality.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Fluctuations in the cost of inputs can significantly influence industry revenue and profit.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Changes in demand for industry goods can also result in potential inefficiency.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Fast Food Chicken Franchises industry has a low level of capital intensity.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: IBISWorld estimates that for every $1.00 spent on wages
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: IBISWorld estimates that for every $1.00 spent on wages, industry operators will spend $0.10 in capital investment in 2020, slightly down from $0.12 in 2015.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The industry remains dependent on human labor across
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry remains dependent on human labor across all areas of operation despite operators' continued efforts to incorporate technology into day-to-day processes.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Over the past five years, the Fast Food Chicken
volatility_points.volatility_description: Over the past five years, the Fast Food Chicken Franchises industry has exhibited a moderate level of revenue volatility.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The industry's growth is primarily dependent on
volatility_points.volatility_description: The industry's growth is primarily dependent on consumer tastes, as well as levels of disposable income.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The Fast Food Chicken Franchises industry has not been
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The Fast Food Chicken Franchises industry has not been disrupted by technological developments.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Developments in inventory control systems have helped
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Developments in inventory control systems have helped industry operators keep the food fresh and reduce overall costs.
Increasing digitalization has encouraged industry operators to develop online ordering and delivery platforms.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: When the economy prospers, individuals typically have higher levels of discretionary income enabling them to frequent industry establishments more frequently.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators offer chicken-based products, such as fried chicken, as well as a variety of side dishes such as french fries.

FAQs.question: Do you contract directly with manufacturers in order to reduce purchase costs?
FAQs.answer: Like many other fast food retailers, industry operators frequently work with wholesalers in order to purchase the necessary ingredients and equipment at more favorable prices.

FAQs.question: Have rising input costs negatively affected your company's sales?
FAQs.answer: The industry's primarily key input is the cost of poultry. Over the five years to 2019, the price of poultry has declined, which as bolstered industry profit margins.

FAQs.question: Does your company use point-of-sale (POS) systems to ensure that the most popular products are kept in stock?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators are consistently investing in POS systems in order to optimize on internal processes.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators are increasingly using kiosks and developing mobile applications so that customers can place their orders and pay in advance, reducing the industry's dependence on labor.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: A significant portion of industry employees are paid at the minimum wage. Over the past five years, states have increased their minimum wages, which has slightly impacted the industry's profitability.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Fast food chicken franchises are careful to abide by health and safety requirements in order to avoid penalties and scandals, which would tarnish the company's reputation.

FAQs.question: Do you have any big projects on the horizon that will require capital financing?
FAQs.answer: As competition intensifies, industry operators are expected to continue to invest in research and development in order to expand their menus.

FAQs.question: How have volatile input prices affected profit margins over the past year?
FAQs.answer: Over the past five years, the price of poultry has significantly decreased, which has bolstered industry wide profit margins.

FAQs.question: What cost control systems do you have in place? How can you cut costs without sacrificing the quality of your products or services?
FAQs.answer: Profit margins are low for industry operators, which makes effective cost controls very important.

FAQs.question: What employee scheduling systems do you use? Are you able to staff more people during peak demand periods?
FAQs.answer: Operators must have access to a high supply of flexible and multiskilled workforce to provide services, particularly in times of high demand.

FAQs.question: How do you attract new franchisees? What support do you offer your franchisees?
FAQs.answer: Franchising is key to industry operations. Enterprises must have solid branding and be attractive to entrepreneurs seeking to establish a franchise to remain successful.

FAQs.question: How have you responded to rising health consciousness? How do you promote the healthfulness of your chicken products?
FAQs.answer: Over the past five years, growth in consumption of poultry has increased while consumption of beef has declined. This shift in consumer preferences has positively affected industry revenue.

FAQs.question: How does the number of domestic trips affect demand for your company? Are you located close to major highways?
FAQs.answer: A significant portion of industry establishments are located in airports and next to highways, making them convenient for customers who are looking for an inexpensive and quick meal while traveling.

FAQs.question: How does rising consumer spending affect your revenue?
FAQs.answer: When consumer spending increases, individuals are more likely to spend money on eating out at industry establishments.
